lines.text: Can't you do something about this?
All I can suggest is that you get down on your knees and pray.
I think that you're right, if God is still on speaking terms with me.
God remains on speaking terms with everybody.
When I needed your faith, you withheld it; and now, when I don't need it, and don't deserve it, you give it to me.
Love without faith, like religion without faith, doesn't amount to very much.
You appear to be nervous. Sleep would do you more good.
What makes you think I'm nervous?
For one thing, your hands are trembling.
It's because you touched me, Doc.
I can't make head or tail outta' you, Mr. Chang. Are you Chinese, or are you white, or what are you?
My mother is Chinese. My father was white.
You look more like a white man to me.
I'm not proud of my white blood.
Oh, you're not, are you?
No, I'm not.
Rather be a Chinaman, huh?
Yes.
What future is there in bein' a Chinaman? You're born, eat your way through a handful of rice, and you die. What a country! Let's have a drink!
It took more than one man to change my name to Shanghai Lily.
You're in China now, sir, where time and life have no value.
I live by my own code.
You only had my interest before, now you have my admiration.
I don't know what you're saying brother... but don't say it again.
